subject: random testing with JUnit
msgSnippet: Hi, I m new to JUnit.  I m wondering what is the right way to set up some random tests? Should I just put into my tests a loop runs the test multiple times?

Hi, I'm new to JUnit.  I'm wondering what is the right way to set up 
some =
random tests?  

Should I just put into my tests a loop runs the test multi=
ple times?  
This seems to imply that the test needs to call setUp() to get=
 some 
fresh objects ("test fixture") each time through the loop, which see=
ms 
somehow wrong (at least I've seen no examples like this).  Is there 
so=
me better way to ask for a test to be run N times?

I got turned on to JUni=
t from the book
   Building Parsers with Java=99 by Steven John Metsker
how=
ever it seems that he does not use JUnit for random tests.  He has 
a secti=
on extolling JUnit, but then a section immediately after about 
random test=
ing that doesn't use JUnit at all.

Perhaps random testing is not considere=
d part of unit testing?  If so, 
why?

Thanks for the help.
--Erik N
